revised_title: Discovery of Unique Worm Shell Species in Sumatra after Earthquake
tldr: This article describes the discovery of a rare species of worm shells on an island off the northwest coast of Sumatra after a violent earthquake in 1797. The shells were found protruding from the mud and were of various shapes and sizes. The author, J. Griffiths, initially thought they were a new genus but later found similar shells described by Rumphius. The shells' unique features include their great length, size, and division in the upper part.
